rp.warehouse.pc.localisation

Class LocaliserAssumption

  • java.lang.Object
    • rp.warehouse.pc.localisation.LocaliserAssumption

  • public class LocaliserAssumption
extends java.lang.Object
    Class to handle the different direction assumptions so that the robot can localise from any given position and direction.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      LocaliserAssumption(byte direction, WarehouseMap map)
      Create an assumption handler for the given direction.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addBlockedLocations(java.util.List<RobotLocation> toBlock)
      Method to add additional blocked locations to the assumption - used to add existing robot locations to prevent them from being assumed again.
      byte getHeading()
      The heading following this assumption.
      int getNumberOfPoints()
      Method to get the number of points of which the robot could possibly be in.
      lejos.geom.Point getPoint()
      The point in the first position of the possible locations array.
      boolean isComplete()
      Method to determine whether this assumption is complete or not.
      void start(Ranges ranges)
      Method to initialise the available positions given a set of ranges.
      java.util.stream.Stream<RobotLocation> stream()
      Method to get a stream of the RobotLocations that are currently possible locations for this assumption handler.
      void update(byte direction, Ranges ranges)
      Update the assumption handler with the direction of which the robot just moved in (relative to the robot), as well as the ranges discovered after moving in that direction.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • LocaliserAssumption

        public LocaliserAssumption(byte direction,
                           WarehouseMap map)
        Create an assumption handler for the given direction.
        Parameters:
        direction - the starting direction of the robot.

    • Method Detail

      • addBlockedLocations

        public void addBlockedLocations(java.util.List<RobotLocation> toBlock)
        Method to add additional blocked locations to the assumption - used to add existing robot locations to prevent them from being assumed again.
        Parameters:
        toBlock - the list of locations to block.

      • start

        public void start(Ranges ranges)
        Method to initialise the available positions given a set of ranges.
        Parameters:
        ranges - the ranges currently read from the robot to start with.

      • update

        public void update(byte direction,
                   Ranges ranges)
        Update the assumption handler with the direction of which the robot just moved in (relative to the robot), as well as the ranges discovered after moving in that direction.
        Parameters:
        direction - the direction just moved in, relative to the robot.
        ranges - the ranges discovered after moving.

      • isComplete

        public boolean isComplete()
        Method to determine whether this assumption is complete or not.
        Returns:
        whether this assumption has completed its localisation or not.

      • getNumberOfPoints

        public int getNumberOfPoints()
        Method to get the number of points of which the robot could possibly be in.
        Returns:
        the number of points that the robot could be in.

      • getPoint

        public lejos.geom.Point getPoint()
        The point in the first position of the possible locations array. Will give the location of the robot after localisation has completed.
        Returns:
        the point of the robot.

      • getHeading

        public byte getHeading()
        The heading following this assumption.
        Returns:
        the robot's heading.

      • stream

        public java.util.stream.Stream<RobotLocation> stream()
        Method to get a stream of the RobotLocations that are currently possible locations for this assumption handler.
        Returns:
        the stream of currently possible locations for this assumption handler.
